intro: Arawakia panamaea, commonly known as the Panama Arawakia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Arawakia panamaea typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small fauna.
